parser

Class DateTimeParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • parser.DateTimeParser

  • public class DateTimeParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the facade class that hides the DateParser and TimeParser from the CommandParsers. Its main functionality is to: a) split string into date and time to be parsed into DateParser and TimeParser respectively b) recognise recurring tasks and process the interval and terminal date-time c) set LocalDateTime variables in TaskObject to be returned to CommandParser Does nothing if no recognizable tasktype is parsed in.
    Author:
    sylvesterchin

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public common.TaskObject parse(java.lang.String input,
                               boolean isForAdd)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is the only method that CommandParser will access. It parses date and time as well as sets LocalDateTime.
        Parameters:
        input - user's input consisting only date-time components. not null.
        isForAdd - boolean to signify if called by AddParser
        Returns:
        task object with LocalDateTime and Interval object filled
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • parseDateTime

        private void parseDateTime(java.lang.String input,
                           boolean isForAdd)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will take in string containing date and time, then splitting it into the date and time separately for parsing through DateParser and TimeParser.
        Parameters:
        input - user input in string format
        isForAdd - boolean to indicate if command is for the add parser
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setLocalDateTime

        private void setLocalDateTime(boolean isForAdd,
                              Constants.TaskType task)
        This method will set appropriate localdatetime for the task object if the task is an event without end date, start date will be used
        Parameters:
        isForAdd - boolean show if the task is for an add command
        task - task type (deadline, event, floating)

        Throws:

      • recur

        private void recur(java.lang.String input)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will split string into the StartDateTime, interval and limiter components of a recurring task identifier Limiter refers to an "until" or "for" restriction to specify the expiry of the task
        Parameters:
        input - string input for recurring tasks with interval, StartDateTime and a limiter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • separateDateTime

        private void separateDateTime(java.lang.String input,
                              java.lang.String type)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will take in string and identify regular expressions for time and date. Creates DateParser object and TimeParser object to parse date and time respectively.
        Parameters:
        input - user's input containing date and time. e.g. 7pm 9 june, tmr 9am
        isStart - type of time/date the user's input will be stored, either as start, end or until.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTaskType

        private Constants.TaskType getTaskType(java.lang.String input)
        This method checks string to identify the task type
        Parameters:
        input - user's input in string format e.g. by tmr 6pm (deadline)
        Returns:
        appropriate task type for the input

      • extractUntilLimiter

        private java.lang.String extractUntilLimiter(java.lang.String input)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This method searches for the regular expression representing end date for recurring tasks that starts with "until".
        Parameters:
        input - string for recurring tasks input. not null.
        Returns:
        remaining string without until-string. not null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • extractForLimiter

        private java.lang.String extractForLimiter(java.lang.String input)
        This method searches for the regular expression representing end date for recurring tasks that starts with "for".
        Parameters:
        input - string for recurring tasks input. not null.
        forstring - for-string, contains "for" keyword and regular expression for number of intervals. null value here returns unchanged input
        Returns:
        remaining string without for-string, not null

      • extractInterval

        private java.lang.String extractInterval(java.lang.String input,
                                         java.lang.String forstring)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method extracts interval string from input. parses start date time string to process start date. calls parseFor to process forstring's count and interval.
        Parameters:
        input - non-null string containing interval and StartDateTime
        forstring - "for" limiter. null if original input has no "for" limit specified
        Returns:
        interval string containing number and frequency of task. not null
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getStartDateFromInterval

        private void getStartDateFromInterval(java.lang.String input)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method will use the frequency from interval to obtain start date if user does not input the start date.
        Parameters:
        input - frequency from the user's input e.g. every 2 tuesday
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This method breaks down string into the interval and frequency to be stored in task object's interval object.
        Parameters:
        input - interval and frequency from user's input e.g. every 5 weeks
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • parseFor

        private void parseFor(java.lang.String input)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method calculates count for the recurring tasks to be repeated
        Parameters:
        input - contains number of repetition (integer, after parsing) and length of each occurrence (string)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • readFirstDayFromInterval

        private java.lang.String readFirstDayFromInterval(java.lang.String input)
        This method will look for the first day in the interval string that corresponds to a day of the week.
        Parameters:
        input - interval string. non null.
        Returns:
        returns day-of=the-week or "everyday" to be parsed by DateParser

      • cleanString

        private java.lang.String cleanString(java.lang.String input)
        This method removes keywords for identifying task. It takes into account for special exceptions such as today, monday and words containing identifier keywords.
        Parameters:
        input - any general string. non-null.
        Returns:

        private void setDaysInWeek(java.lang.String input)
        This method sets byDay array in interval object according to the days that are present
        Parameters:
        input - string containing days which the task falls on. not null

      • hasNumber

        private boolean hasNumber(java.lang.String input)
        This method checks if the string starts with a number.
        Parameters:
        input - date input with interval such as a day of the week, "weeks" or "months" with integer in front as a multiplier
        Returns:

      • getMultiplier

        private int getMultiplier(java.lang.String forInput,
                          java.lang.String intervalInput)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns multiplier for calculating the task's interval count for example, every day for 1 month will return 30 as there are 30 days in a month on average.
        Parameters:
        forInput - date frequency such as weeks or months. not null
        intervalInput - date frequency such as weeks or months, not null
        Returns:
        multiplier (integer) based on the relationship between intervalinput and forinput
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getNextNearestDayInInterval

        private java.lang.String getNextNearestDayInInterval()
        This method searches for the next available day in the week that the user entered in the interval.
        Returns:
        day of the week in string format. not null.

      • getDayInWeek

        private java.lang.String getDayInWeek(int index)
        This method returns corresponding date to a given number from 1 - 7.
        Parameters:
        index - number of the day in the week (1 - monday, 2 - tuesday, etc)
        Returns:
        returns corresponding day in string. not null.

      • getFormattedFrequency

        private java.lang.String getFormattedFrequency(java.lang.String frequency)
        This method returns the frequency type based on input string, in standardised format.
        Parameters:
        frequency - frequency extracted from interval. non-null. e.g. years, days, etc.
        Returns:
        frequency of occurence in string. not null.
